item.title: Git checkout
item.description: Git checkout git checkout æ£€å‡ºå‘½ä»¤ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç”¨æ¥åˆ‡æ¢åˆ†æ”¯ã€æŸ¥çœ‹æŸä¸ª commit çš„ä»£ç ç­‰ã€‚ detached HEAD å½“ä½ æ‰§è¡Œ git checkout [commitId] æ—¶ï¼Œä½ ä¼šçœ‹åˆ°ä¸‹é¢çš„æ–‡ä»¶è­¦å‘Šï¼š Note: switching to '467dd6520'. You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this state without impacting any branches by switching back to a branch. If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may do so (now or later) by using -c with the switch command.

item.title: Binary Search äºŒåˆ†æœç´¢
item.description: Binary Search // https://leetcode.com/problems/binary-search/ // public class BinarySearch { public int search(int[] nums, int target) { if (nums == null || nums.length == 0) { return -1; } int lo = 0; int hi = nums.length - 1; while (lo <= hi) { int m = lo + ((hi - lo) >> 1); if (nums[m] == target) { return m; } else if (nums[m] > target) { hi = m - 1; } else { lo = m + 1; } } return -1; } }

item.description: æœ€å°çš„Kä¸ªæ•° import java.util.ArrayList; // ç‰›å®¢ç½‘ // https://www.nowcoder.com/practice/6a296eb82cf844ca8539b57c23e6e9bf // æœ€å°çš„ k ä¸ªæ•° // public class KSmallestNumInAnArray { public ArrayList<Integer> GetLeastNumbers_Solution(int[] input, int k) { int lo = 0; int hi = input.length - 1; while (lo <= hi) { int kth = partition(input, lo, hi); if (kth == k - 1) { ArrayList<Integer> res = new ArrayList<>(); for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) { res.add(input[i]); } return res; } else if (kth < k - 1) { lo = kth + 1; } else { hi = kth - 1; } } return new ArrayList<Integer>(); } private int partition(int[] nums, int lo, int hi) { int left = lo - 1; int pivot = nums[hi]; for (int i = lo; i <= hi - 1; i++) { if (nums[i] <= pivot) { swap(nums, ++left, i); } } swap(nums, left + 1, hi); return left + 1; } private void swap(int[] nums, int i, int j) { int tmp = nums[i]; nums[i] = nums[j]; nums[j] = tmp; } }
